text: <@U0183C24N84> has joined the channel

Hi, I have a question about market catalogues. We request market catalogue at about 9-9.30 in the morning from betfair and use that throughout the day. I have noticed that sometimes events are added to the market catalogue at later times and this causes us issues.  Does anyone know the rules about when new events are added or removed from the market catalogue, is there any guarantees about time?

elements.text: Hi, I have a question about market catalogues. We request market catalogue at about 9-9.30 in the morning from betfair and use that throughout the day. I have noticed that sometimes events are added to the market catalogue at later times and this causes us issues.  Does anyone know the rules about when new events are added or removed from the market catalogue, is there any guarantees about time?

text: Why not continue to poll it throughout the day?

elements.text: Why not continue to poll it throughout the day?

text: at the moment its to make deployment safer -- betfair can go down temporarily

elements.text: at the moment its to make deployment safer -- betfair can go down temporarily

text: so to prevent issues and to "fail early" we request on startup and then reuse this -- it would also be more complicated in code to update it throughout the day (although its possible)

elements.text: so to prevent issues and to "fail early" we request on startup and then reuse this -- it would also be more complicated in code to update it throughout the day (although its possible)

text: Can you expand on this because it makes no sense

attachments.fallback: [July 29th, 2020 10:17 AM] robert: at the moment its to make deployment safer -- betfair can go down temporarily
attachments.text: at the moment its to make deployment safer -- betfair can go down temporarily

elements.text: Can you expand on this because it makes no sense

text: betfair website often goes down and stops responding -- its not super rare

elements.text: betfair website often goes down and stops responding -- its not super rare

text: How is that relevant?

elements.text: How is that relevant?

text: because then I cant request the market catalogue again if its down

elements.text: because then I cant request the market catalogue again if its down

text: So store them

elements.text: So store them

text: its not that relevant since I can just only update if its there

elements.text: its not that relevant since I can just only update if its there

text: it sort of doesnt change the question even if I update it throughout the day -- I need to know how it changes because maybe half way through the day they change the market catalogues and I need to know what sort of changes they can make

elements.text: it sort of doesnt change the question even if I update it throughout the day -- I need to know how it changes because maybe half way through the day they change the market catalogues and I need to know what sort of changes they can make

text: I don't think you can make any assumptions about when markets are added

elements.text: I don't think you can make any assumptions about when markets are added

text: The market start time does get updated but the point of the market catalogue is for it to be largely static data

elements.text: The market start time does get updated but the point of the market catalogue is for it to be largely static data

text: yeah I have not seen issues with it changing -- the only change I worry about is market catalogues being added or removed

elements.text: yeah I have not seen issues with it changing -- the only change I worry about is market catalogues being added or removed

text: Then poll it throughout the day

elements.text: Then poll it throughout the day

text: it would require large changes and adds comlexity to what I am running -- it would be much simpler if we knew for example that befair only updates this before X

elements.text: it would require large changes and adds comlexity to what I am running -- it would be much simpler if we knew for example that befair only updates this before X

text: for now I will just start later since I used to start it an hour later since I used to and didnt see this problem before -- if issue still happens I will poll it

elements.text: for now I will just start later since I used to start it an hour later since I used to and didnt see this problem before -- if issue still happens I will poll it

text: a related question -- I know sometimes betfair will remove a market book -- does it ever remove and then add back in a market book?

elements.text: a related question -- I know sometimes betfair will remove a market book -- does it ever remove and then add back in a market book?

text: I imagine it doesnt

elements.text: I imagine it doesnt

text: Betfair can update at any time in any way. I have even seen Betfair get the markets completely wrong, close a market, and then create a new one in its place. You can make no assumptions about anything Betfair does with markets as they can literally do anything

elements.text: Betfair can update at any time in any way. I have even seen Betfair get the markets completely wrong, close a market, and then create a new one in its place. You can make no assumptions about anything Betfair does with markets as they can literally do anything

text: They can also get start times wrong, leave runner meta-data out, etc, There is no other solution than to poll all day

elements.text: They can also get start times wrong, leave runner meta-data out, etc, There is no other solution than to poll all day

text: yeah I agree I have seen plenty of weird and wrong data myself too

elements.text: yeah I agree I have seen plenty of weird and wrong data myself too

text: thanks for the help all

elements.text: thanks for the help all

text: By favourite failure, because it is pretty bad, is putting up races with no saddle cloth numbers. It happens more regularly than you would expect

elements.text: By favourite failure, because it is pretty bad, is putting up races with no saddle cloth numbers. It happens more regularly than you would expect

text: ive seen wrong race times and horse names before

elements.text: ive seen wrong race times and horse names before

text: not much though -- but happens

elements.text: not much though -- but happens

text: Yep - win and place for same race with different start times!

elements.text: Yep - win and place for same race with different start times!

text: How safe is it to rely on the Selection IDs in this situation? Do they ever get those IDs wrong for a race between the Win/Place/EW etc?

elements.text: How safe is it to rely on the Selection IDs in this situation? Do they ever get those IDs wrong for a race between the Win/Place/EW etc?

text: I don't ever use selection ids for matching. For racing it's horse names and saddle cloth numbers (or tab numbers in Australia)

elements.text: I don't ever use selection ids for matching. For racing it's horse names and saddle cloth numbers (or tab numbers in Australia)

text: I view a selection id as an internal Betfair identifier used within a market. Their may be a pattern of the use of selection ids across markets for the same event, but I have never seen documentation that guarantees this, so I don't assume it

elements.text: I view a selection id as an internal Betfair identifier used within a market. Their may be a pattern of the use of selection ids across markets for the same event, but I have never seen documentation that guarantees this, so I don't assume it

text: Ok thanks

elements.text: Ok thanks

text: Hi guys, - question for those of you who are using the undocumented inplayservice to record/analyse tennis scores. I have set up my recorder and I am noticing often that scores only seem to become available about 30 minutes into the match so quite often my recordings are starting at 4-4 or 3-4 etc. Is this normal or is there something wrong in my code?

elements.text: Hi guys, - question for those of you who are using the undocumented inplayservice to record/analyse tennis scores. I have set up my recorder and I am noticing often that scores only seem to become available about 30 minutes into the match so quite often my recordings are starting at 4-4 or 3-4 etc. Is this normal or is there something wrong in my code?

text: Crappy exhibition matches I would assume. I'm waiting for the real matches to start to see exactly how well each endpoint works (there is also a proper scores service)

elements.text: Crappy exhibition matches I would assume. I'm waiting for the real matches to start to see exactly how well each endpoint works (there is also a proper scores service)

text:
To be honest I have not observed it being THAT bad although it's entirely possible I haven't been paying close enough attention.

I've definitely seen scores flip flop between points though.

elements.text:
To be honest I have not observed it being THAT bad although it's entirely possible I haven't been paying close enough attention.

I've definitely seen scores flip flop between points though.

text: It's hard to say if your code is a problem without knowing exactly how you're doing it

elements.text: It's hard to say if your code is a problem without knowing exactly how you're doing it

text: If you give me a recent example I can check my scores log

elements.text: If you give me a recent example I can check my scores log

text: Is the logging in flumine just there so people can set the level, debug and print to the console. Am I right in assuming that the expectation is to define output files, levels, format etcs ?

elements.text: Is the logging in flumine just there so people can set the level, debug and print to the console. Am I right in assuming that the expectation is to define output files, levels, format etcs ?
